tool_description: Capitalize your titles using logic from the leading title capitalization tool.
name: Capitalize My Title
title: Capitalize My Title

api_list.name: getTitle
api_list.description: API endpoint for Capitalize My Title

required_parameters.name: title
required_parameters.description: The {title} input is the title that you want to capitalize. Without styles specified, the title will be capitalized using [APA style rules in title case](https://capitalizemytitle.com/#APAStyle).

api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://capitalize-my-title.p.rapidapi.com/title/capitalize this title"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "capitalize-my-title.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://capitalize-my-title.p.rapidapi.com/title/{title}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "capitalize-my-title.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: getTitleWithStyleAndSubstyle
api_list.description: API endpoint for Capitalize My Title with style and sub-style

required_parameters.name: style
required_parameters.description:
The {style} input can be any of the following:

- apa: Capitalize using the APA manual style guidelines.
- chicago: Capitalize using the Chicago Manual of Style guidelines.
- ap: Capitalize using the Associated Press Stylebook 2020 (55th edition).
- mla: Capitalize using the MLA Handbook, 8th edition style rules.
- nyt: Capitalize with the NY Times style rules.
- ama: Capitalize using the American Medical Association (AMA) Manual of Style, 11th edition
- bb: Capitalize using the The Bluebook, 21st edition
- wikipedia: Capitalize with the Wikipedia style rules.
- email: Capitalize with standard email style rules.

required_parameters.name: substyle
required_parameters.description:
The {substyle} input can be any of the following:

-  title-case: Capitalize the first letter of important words.
- sentence-case: Capitalize only the first word of each sentence. [More details](https://capitalizemytitle.com/#WhatiosTitleCase).
- uppercase: Uppercase all letters.
- lowercase: Lowercase all letters.
- first-letter: Capitalize the first letter of every word.
- alt-case: Capitalize every other letter of your text starting with the first letter being capitalized.
- toggle-case: Change the case of every letter in your string.

api_list.code:
import requests

url = "https://capitalize-my-title.p.rapidapi.com/title/ap/title-case/capitalize this title now"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "capitalize-my-title.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())
api_list.convert_code:
import requests

url = "https://capitalize-my-title.p.rapidapi.com/title/{style}/{substyle}/{title}"

headers = {
            "X-RapidAPI-Key": "SIGN-UP-FOR-KEY",
            "X-RapidAPI-Host": "capitalize-my-title.p.rapidapi.com"
        }

response = requests.get(url, headers=headers)
print(response.json())

api_list.name: getTitleWithStyle
api_list.description: API endpoint for Capitalize My Title with one style.

required_parameters.name: style
required_parameters.description:
The {style} input can be any of the following:

- apa: Capitalize using the APA manual style guidelines.
- chicago: Capitalize using the Chicago Manual of Style guidelines.
- ap: Capitalize using the Associated Press Stylebook 2020 (55th edition).
- mla: Capitalize using the MLA Handbook, 8th edition style rules.
- nyt: Capitalize with the NY Times style rules.
- ama: Capitalize using the American Medical Association (AMA) Manual of Style, 11th edition
- bb: Capitalize using the The Bluebook, 21st edition
- wikipedia: Capitalize with the Wikipedia style rules.
- email: Capitalize with standard email style rules.
-  title-case: Capitalize the first letter of important words.
- sentence-case: Capitalize only the first word of each sentence. [More details](https://capitalizemytitle.com/#WhatiosTitleCase).
- uppercase: Uppercase all letters.
- lowercase: Lowercase all letters.
- first-letter: Capitalize the first letter of every word.
- alt-case: Capitalize every other letter of your text starting with the first letter being capitalized.
- toggle-case: Change the case of every letter in your string.

required_parameters.name: title
required_parameters.description: The {title} input is the title that you want to capitalize.
